channel.title: Help my brother find a car!

item.title: Help my brother find a car!
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:22, topic:258429”][quote author=the bank link=topic=341262.msg2642256#msg2642256 date=1232957338]
Also, your calculations don’t take into view both weight and aerodynamics of the vehicles.

I strongly believe an s2000 would blow away any charger.

Using your theory, a massive transport truck would also win in a race against the s2000.
[/quote]

You strongly believe wrong, how about some facts:
S2000:
http://www.roadandtrack.com/article.asp?section_id=10&article_id=6880
Charger:
http://www.roadandtrack.com/assets/download/0309_ct_dodgeVSpontiac_chart.pdf
Dodge Challenger:
http://www.roadandtrack.com/assets/download/0708_rt_Challenger_dp.pdf

All actual road tests, and the charger always outperforms the S2000. The charger weighs not quite twice as much, but 425 ft-lbs of torque vs 160 ft-lbs of torque far outweighs the difference. And the charger sounds amazing, whereas I imagine the honda sounds approximately like a chainsaw.[/quote]The challenger is beautiful.

I’m probably just biased because I hate the look of the Charger :P.

Read full topic
item.source: Help my brother find a car!

item.title: Help my brother find a car!
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

[quote=“OnlyOneRule, post:1, topic:258639”][quote author=Fat Cookies link=topic=341262.msg2642599#msg2642599 date=1232994897]

No more than 8k euros.

That means this guy lives in Europe. A fat 30ft wide Dodge is useless in the Narrow streets of some cities in Europe.
[/quote]
Yeah in smelly France maybe. I live in Holland. We have pretty decent raods.[/quote]

Heh not everywhere in Holland, go to cities like Amsterdam, Almere or Groningen and it isn’t drivable :D!

Mopar, sure the Charger might blow the S2000 away… How ever compare this:

Charger: curb weight 4,160 lbs.
S2000: curb weight 2,813 lbs.

Engine
Charger: 6.1L V-8
S2000: 2.2L I-4
Horsepower
Charger: 425 @ 6,000 rpm
S2000: 237 @ 7,800 rpm
Torque
Charger: 420 @ 4,800 rpm
S2000: 162 @ 6,800 rpm

-The weight difference between the Charger and the S2000 is 1.347lbs;
-The engine difference is 4 cylinders (Charger has a V-8 while the S2000 has a Inline 4);
-The engine size difference is 3.900cc³ (the Charger has 6.1 liter while the S2000 has 2.2 liter);
-The S2000 peaks 237BHP @ 7,800 RPM and redlines at 9.000RPM (valves start to float at 10.250 RPM) while the Charger peaks it’s BHP at 6.000 RPM;
-The Charger wins in torque, because of the 6.1 liter V8 engine, but torque isn’t everything;
-The S2000 is linked to a close ratio 6 speed gearbox, and because of the internal geometry of the S2000 engine it can be revved easily to the 9.000 RPM, thus while the charge has to shift around 6.800 RPM the S2000 is coming to peak power and can go on to the 9.000 RPM and has to shift then.

I’m not pro this or pro that (I know I might look pro Honda) I realy like American muscle cars (the Charger is damn sexy) and I like the roaring sound of a big block V8 blown/unblown.

And if were talking about engine size… I can bring in my black beast (R34 V-Spec), ok thats a twin turbo charged engine, but it has a 2.6 liter 6 straight engine. Produces 320BHP and weights 1.550kg.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:258429”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=341262.msg2642179#msg2642179 date=1232944429]

WRX.

SUX.

Compare that with the charger and s2000 too, charger still wins:

http://www.cars.com/go/compare/trimCompare.jsp?acodes=USB90DOC201D0,USB90HOC051B0,USB90SUC081A0

Yes because a good car ONLY means can be thrashed on the road. Put those two on dirt, and I’d love to see who wins
[/quote]

You can get a charger R/T in AWD, and it would beat the WRX on the dirt. Hell, the SRT8 might still beat the WRX on dirt.[/quote]
sif, btw by the dirt I mean leik rally track, twisting between trees, etc.

item.title: Help my brother find a car!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:13, topic:258429”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=341262.msg2642119#msg2642119 date=1232942039]

WRX.

SUX.

Compare that with the charger and s2000 too, charger still wins:

Cars.com

Car Comparison Tool | Cars.com

Compare MSRP, invoice prices, crash test results, mileage and available transmissions side-by-side for up to 4 cars, trucks, minivans, vans or SUVs.


[/quote]
Yes because a good car ONLY means can be thrashed on the road. Put those two on dirt, and I’d love to see who wins ;)[/quote]

You can get a charger R/T in AWD, and it would beat the WRX on the dirt. Hell, the SRT8 might still beat the WRX on dirt.

[quote=“Pwnd, post:14, topic:258429”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=341262.msg2642171#msg2642171 date=1232943947]

Mopar, you’re just biased, l0l.

WHERE IS FORD IN YOUR LIST? ITS AMERICAN MADE???

Maybe I am biased, but I bring facts that support me.

Ford doesn’t really make any good cars anymore though.
[/quote]Exactly.

Also, fuel economy of American cars suck for the most part.

Plus, for the normal car user, Asian cars outlast most American made cars and they look cooler![/quote]

Really the gas mileage is similar between these 3 cars, chargers in reality get much better than advertised. And American cars look much cooler (obviously an opinion, but many share it with me) and American cars definitely last longer. Case in point, my 1989 Chevy S10 that ran 314,000 miles before the motor blew. I put in a new engine, and I expect another 314,000 miles out of it.

edit:
for people who say the charger doesn’t look good, this is an SRT8:

It’s fuckin’ hot!

item.title: Help my brother find a car!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Waffendennis, post:7, topic:258429”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=341262.msg2641394#msg2641394 date=1232903582]
Your brother has horrible taste in cars, every car you listed sucks…
[/quote]

Meh :D! The S2000 isn’t a horrible car :X! Heck look at the engine a 2.0 litre engine producing 250 BHP… N/A! Where most cars can only produce 160/185bhp turbocharged this engine produces 250 BHP natural aspired ;). Sure I look like pro Honda and Nissan (Skyline) but it’s for a reason. I love American muscle cars too ofcourse, but nothing can beat the technology of the rising sun in cars.

Sure the S2000 doesn’t has the sexy sound of a blown V6 3.0 litre or a V8 engine.
But it doesn’t weighs as much as one but it has RWD and a mid engine setup linked to a very close ratio 6 speed gearbox. the F/R ratio is 50/50 because of the engine sitting behind the driver.[/quote]

Comparing the Dodge Charger SRT-8 against the Honda S2000 it sure seems like the S2000 is a horrible car:

Cars.com

Car Comparison Tool | Cars.com

Compare MSRP, invoice prices, crash test results, mileage and available transmissions side-by-side for up to 4 cars, trucks, minivans, vans or SUVs.

A quick rundown, both have equal front and rear weight distributions, both naturally aspirated, the charger holds 4 people, the honda just 2, they are pretty much the same price, and here is the power they put out:

Charger:
Horsepower: 425 @ 6,000 rpm
Torque: 420 @ 4,800 rpm

S2000:
Horsepower: 237 @ 7,800 rpm
Torque: 162 @ 6,800 rpm

One would obviously win in a race, wouldn’t it?

Read full topic
item.source: Help my brother find a car!

item.title: Help my brother find a car!
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Your brother has horrible taste in cars, every car you listed sucks…

Meh :D! The S2000 isn’t a horrible car :X! Heck look at the engine a 2.0 litre engine producing 250 BHP… N/A! Where most cars can only produce 160/185bhp turbocharged this engine produces 250 BHP natural aspired ;). Sure I look like pro Honda and Nissan (Skyline) but it’s for a reason. I love American muscle cars too ofcourse, but nothing can beat the technology of the rising sun in cars.

Sure the S2000 doesn’t has the sexy sound of a blown V6 3.0 litre or a V8 engine.
But it doesn’t weighs as much as one but it has RWD and a mid engine setup linked to a very close ratio 6 speed gearbox. the F/R ratio is 50/50 because of the engine sitting behind the driver.
